comments:
Cannot launch and profile local applications due to incorrect classpath in 
Hyades 3.0.

For example, using the Hyades Apache Commons Logging Sample, trying to launch 
the HyadesLoggingCommonsSample class in profiling mode (e.g. Run >> Profile >> 
Java Application >> HyadesLoggingCommonsSample) with logging enabled and the 
org.eclipse.hyades.logging.commons.sample.HyadesLoggingCommonsSample logging 
Logging Agent added to the list of Logging Agents (see the example's readme), 
the following output is written to the Profiling Console:

java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: 
org/eclipse/hyades/logging/commons/sample/HyadesLoggingCommonsSample

This is caused by a lack of classpath delimiters; the classpath entries are 
simply concatenated, so the initial entry that contains the main class is no 
longer read properly by the VM, and the main class can't be found. To be fixed 
after M8.
*** Bug 57740 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

This problem has reappeared.
From newsgroup:

I have problem profiling applications from Eclipse using Hyades plugin.
When I run application, that doesn't reference any external jars it runs OK.

When I start Profiling an application which references classes I am getting NoClassDefFoundError, but 
when I check the application properties, the jar in question is listed in classpath.

java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/apache/lucene/analysis/Analyzer
at com.insightful.infact.ontology.util.OntologyLookup.main(OntologyLookup.java:92)
Exception in thread "main" Note that I am using for profiling same Run/Debug eclipse profile which 
works OK otherwise.
I also tried creating standalone java application result, but get the same result.

I use Eclipse 3.1, Haydes 3.2.0, (had same problems with Haydes 3.1).
Java 1.4.2_03.
Platform is Windows XP.
Terry, please have a look..  this one is important.

Eclipse 3.1 is not the support base of Haydes 3.2.0. Only Eclipse 3.0.x is 
support on Hyades 3.2.0. The current plan is Hyades 4.x on Eclipse 3.1.x.

The scenario I ran was as follows.
I created an application that references classes in external jar files.  I 
tested some variations on this.  I had the main method in the jar file, the 
main method in the workspace, which called classes in the external jar files.  
I also just ran the applications in the workspace.

I was unable to reproduce this with the latest code from HEAD and Eclipse 3.0.1.

I also grabbed Eclipse 3.1 with new EMF-SDO-XSD drivers from www.eclipse.org.  
I tried the different scenarios again, with the latest code from HEAD.  I was 
unable to reproduce the problem.  However, we aren't currently supporting 
Hyades 3.2 on top of Eclipse 3.1.  While I was able to launch the workbench, 
there were many compile errors with this arrangement, that would affect other 
areas of Hyades.
Do you get into the same problems if you try to just run instead of profile ?
Unable to reproduce the problem using Hyades 3.2 on Eclipse 3.0.1

Working as designed.  Verified in Toronto's 20041117_1805 (HEAD) build on 
November 22, 2004.

I have installed Eclipse 3.01 and reinstalled Hyades 3.2, and I am still 
getting NoClassDefFoundError, when I profile the application and class is 
located in jar file.
So Eclipse 3.1 is not the culprit.
It must be something peculiar in my setup, the main application class is in 
classes subdirectory of the current application directory, but external jars 
are in ../external/lib/*.jar jar files.
When I check the properties dialog, the jars are in the classpath properly, 
but profiler cannot find them (sorry I cannot copy the classpath from the 
dialog, because the properties dialog is non-sensitive, and doesn't allow 
copy).

It looks like the bug should be reopened, and I would be glad to help to debug 
the problem.
Terry, can you please take a look at this again.

I found that a class not found exception can occur if the class path has new 
line characters in it.  We updated the source to fix this particular problem.
Verified in Toronto's 20041206_1849 (HEAD) build on December 7, 2004.
